title: Vegan Sweet Potato Chickpea Curry Recipe
description: This chickpea curry recipe made with sweet potatoes, spinach, tomatoes, and coconut milk uses fragrant Indian spices to make a delicious vegan meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Indian Vegan Sweet Potato Chickpea Curry 4.7 (125) 110 Reviews 20 Photos This chickpea curry recipe with sweet potato and spinach is seasoned with fragrant spices for a yummy vegan dish. Serve with basmati rice and naan bread. Submitted by Sherri Zeringue D'Argenio Updated on January 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 20 20 20 20 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 3 tablespoons olive oil 1 onion, chopped 2 cloves garlic, minced 2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger root 1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas, drained 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes 1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk 1 sweet potato, cubed 1 tablespoon garam masala 1 teaspoon ground cumin 1 teaspoon ground turmeric ½ teaspoon salt ¼ teaspoon red chile flakes 1 cup baby spinach Directions Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook onion, garlic, and ginger in hot oil until softened, about 5 minutes. Add chickpeas, tomatoes, coconut milk, and sweet potato. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes. Season with garam masala, cumin, turmeric, salt, and chile flakes. Add spinach right before serving. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Vegan Sweet Potato Chickpea Curry 01 of 20 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 20 Photo by  Jedi Chimp 03/27/2025 Might try again I used two sweet potatoes instead of just one, I'm not a big fan of coconut so I only used half the amount of coconut milk, although next time I might use a plant based cream instead.Having said all of this I did enjoy it and will probably make it again at some point 03 of 20 Photo by  FlashyPho1601 01/30/2025 Family favorite A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser Worth the effort This was so easy to make and it tastes delicious. A real comfort food in winter !I did semi cook the sweet potato before adding to the frying pan and also cut them a lot smaller. I also used frozen spinach because it’s all I had and added slightly more than the recipe as I like spinach.5 stars 🌟 🌟🌟🌟🌟 04 of 20 Photo by  EdgyWater9523 01/19/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Very delicious 😋. Easy to follow recipe. I enjoyed it.Cut the sweet potatoes a bit smaller and seasoned with salt after adding the chickpeas 05 of 20 Photo by  DaringBeet8031 01/14/2025 10/10! I subbed sweet potatoes for regular potatoes since it’s what I had also added some carrots I had and mushroom. Couldn’t find garam masala at my store so subbed it with curry powder and added some paprika for extra spice.also added the spices when sautéing the vegetables for a bit before adding the coconut milk and diced tomatoes. 06 of 20 Photo by  EdgySpam5244 11/22/2023 Love this recipe!! I cooked for around 30 people in my spiritual community and they loved it!We don’t eat onion or garlic so I chopped some cabbage up and sautéed it with this spice called hing to give it a similar flavor. I also baked the diced sweet potatoes separately and added them in at the end!! This gave them a very nice texture and allowed them to cook all the way through.This photo just doesn’t do justice, it was a hit!!! The 5 gallon tray was empty in an hour!Thanks for the recipe and Hare Krishna ;) 07 of 20 Photo by  RowdyRind7835 10/07/2023 Tasty and easy. This will be a new staple! It also works with other greens (even frozen), and a sprinkle of fenugreek leaves really enhances it. 08 of 20 Photo by  SpiffySieve2701 03/30/2023 Absolutely loved this! I added a bit of water to allow the potatoes to cook some more and a little bit of spicy curry paste too. 09 of 20 Photo by  NiftyThyme2479 03/30/2023 Warming and comforting this dish was simple and just what I needed.I def added more spices than the amounts given and it was perfect for me.I sprinkled a bit of goat cheese on top and it was great. 10 of 20 Photo by  BMelody Singleton 03/13/2023 Delicious!! I added a little more seasoning to suit my taste and it came out amazing… I received raving reviews… especially from meat lovers 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love One-Pot Vegan Potato Lentil Curry 11 Ratings Vegan Indian Curry with Cauliflower and Lentils 32 Ratings Pumpkin, Butter Bean, and Spinach Curry 13 Ratings Instant Pot® Vegan Korma 3 Ratings Chana Masala (Chickpeas and Tomatoes) 40 Ratings Pumpkin Curry with Lentils and Apples 65 Ratings Vegan Butternut Squash and Chickpea Curry 3 Ratings Vegan Coconut-Lentil Curry with Sweet Potatoes 6 Ratings Vegan Potato and Butternut Squash Curry 2 Ratings Farro and Lentil Masala 3 Ratings Quick Vegetable Curry 17 Ratings Spicy Vegan Potato Curry 1,154 Ratings Green Curry with Sweet Potato and Eggplant 5 Ratings Sweet and Spicy Curry with Chickpeas 52 Ratings Channa Masala (Chickpea Curry) 74 Ratings Vegetarian Red Lentil Coconut Curry Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Sherri Zeringue D'Argenio
instructions: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook onion, garlic, and ginger in hot oil until softened, about 5 minutes. Add chickpeas, tomatoes, coconut milk, and sweet potato. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes.;Season with garam masala, cumin, turmeric, salt, and chile flakes. Add spinach right before serving.
